metadata.Title: CVE-2016-0718 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Expat allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via a malformed input document, which triggers a buffer overflow.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-0718` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

expat - 2.1.1-1ubuntu1
libexpat1 - 2.1.1-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

firefox - 48.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 48.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 48.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

tla - 1.3.5+dfsg-15
No subscription required

notes.Note: ebarretto> tla uses system expat as of 1.3.5+dfsg-15

criterions.comment: cadaver package in focal is affected and needs fixing.
coin3 package in focal is affected and needs fixing.
expat package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1.1-1ubuntu1').
firefox package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '48.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
libxmltok package in focal is affected and needs fixing.
matanza package in focal is affected and needs fixing.
swish-e package in focal is affected and needs fixing.
tla package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.5+dfsg-15').
xmlrpc-c package in focal is affected and needs fixing.
